intro: Myrsine achradifolia, commonly known as the smooth-leaved myrsine, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many plants with medicinal properties. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are usually smooth and glossy. Its small white flowers are clustered in umbels, and it produces small, black berries as fruit. Myrsine achradifolia is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks.
